citations.narrative:
During inspection it was seen that three adult guinea pigs and 1 juvenile guinea pig had escaped their primary enclosures
and were running around the floor of the barn. There was no indication of which enclosure the escaped animals were
from.
Going over the edge of the enclosures and falling to the floor could injure the guinea pigs. In addition the floor is not
designed as an enclosure and could lead to further guinea pig injury.
All primary enclosures shall be structurally sound and in good repair as to contain the guinea pigs and protect them from
injury.
Correction date: January 31st, 2024

One of the primary enclosures contained 16 juvenile guinea pigs. Nearly all of the guinea pigs had ears that had been
chewed. There were small streaks of fresh blood on the sides of the enclosures and some of the wounds on the ears
were weeping blood. One brown guinea pig with a white face had a small bleeding wound below the left eye. The facility
representative reported that none of the guinea pigs were injured yesterday and he split the group into two enclosures at
the time of inspection.
Animals that are housed together and become aggressive towards each other and can cause injury and are not
compatible.
Animals housed in the same primary enclosure must be maintained in compatible groups.
Correction Date: January 31st, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.25(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
During inspection it was seen that three adult guinea pigs and 1 juvenile guinea pig had escaped their primary enclosures 
and were running around the floor of the barn. There was no indication of which enclosure the escaped animals were 
from.  
Going over the edge of the enclosures and falling to the floor could injure the guinea pigs. In addition the floor is not 
designed as an enclosure and could lead to further guinea pig injury.  
All primary enclosures shall be structurally sound and in good repair as to contain the guinea pigs and protect them from 
injury.  
Correction date: January 31st, 2024 
3.33 
   
Classification and separation. 
One of the primary enclosures contained 16 juvenile guinea pigs. Nearly all of the guinea pigs had ears that had been 
chewed. There were small streaks of fresh blood on the sides of the enclosures and some of the wounds on the ears 
were weeping blood. One brown guinea pig with a white face had a small bleeding wound below the left eye. The facility 
representative  reported that none of the guinea pigs were injured yesterday and he split the group into two enclosures at 
the time of inspection. 
Animals that are housed together and become aggressive  towards each other and can cause injury and are not 
compatible.  
Animals housed in the same primary enclosure must be maintained in compatible groups.  
Correction Date: January 31st, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
